column4: Hello. I want to open a .docx file. It seems to be MS's new "open" document format. I know it's evil and I rather should delete this from my ubuntu pc and my brain immediately ... but how _could_ I open it? Just in theory, purely academic ;-)
use docs.google.com and convert it in there
hmmm, converting the document at docs.google.com means it has to leave my pc which is not possible. How can I convert it locally on my ubuntu pc?
ah ok at least you have net access... ok one sec
sorry was wondering if you had msoffice 2007: http://www.softpedia.com/get/Windows-Widgets/System-Utilities/Docx-Converter.shtml run that in wine
cwillu: Thank you. What license is there for the novell tool? GPL?
im guessing they are not going to look exactly the same after conversion btw
Shouldn't it be attached to it then?

the odf-converter-1.0.0-5.i586.rpm file works only on SUSE® Linux Enterprise, SUSE Linux, and openSUSE. On both platforms, the OpenXML Translator works only with the latest Novell® edition of OpenOffice.org.
2008-01-11T15:41:00.000Z	Josiah	vlt	 http://lxer.com/module/newswire/view/89718/index.html
2008-01-11T15:53:00.000Z	Josiah	vlt	in this article they are discussing the openxml and if it is gpl or not: http://blogs.zdnet.com/Berlind/?p=204
2008-01-11T15:53:00.000Z	Josiah	vlt	 sorry dont feel like reading it
2008-01-11T15:54:00.000Z	Josiah	vlt	 it looks like its BSD not GPL
2008-01-11T15:55:00.000Z	Josiah	vlt	 so Microsoft can take it proprietary (including any improvements that naive members of the community may make to it) any time it changes it - for example when it releases Word 2008 or Excel 2008
